title: 105_s1763
content:
The Act titled "Food Stamp Benefits for Aliens Restoration Act of 1997" limits eligibility of qualified aliens for certain federal programs. The Act "Food Stamp Benefits for Aliens Restoration Act of 1997" amends Section 402(a) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to modify eligibility criteria for qualified aliens in federal programs. The Act "Food Stamp Benefits for Aliens Restoration Act of 1997" amends Section 402(a) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to modify eligibility criteria for qualified aliens in federal programs by adjusting subparagraph (D) and indenting clauses appropriately. The Act "Food Stamp Benefits for Aliens Restoration Act of 1997" amends Section 402(a) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 to modify eligibility criteria for qualified aliens in federal programs by adjusting subparagraphs and clauses. It includes changes such as redesignating clauses and striking certain phrases for clarification. Section 402(b)(2)(F) and Section 403(d) of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 are amended to remove specific subsection references for clarity. SEC. 3. FIVE-YEAR LIMITED ELIGIBILITY OF QUALIFIED ALIENS FOR FEDERAL MEANS-TESTED PUBLIC BENEFIT. Amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act to include assistance under the Food Stamp Act of 1977 for qualified aliens.

SEC. 4. AUTHORITY FOR STATES TO PROVIDE FOR ATTRIBUTION OF SPONSORS INCOME AND RESOURCES TO THE ALIEN WITH RESPECT TO STATE PROGRAMS. Amends the Act to allow states to attribute sponsors' income and resources to aliens for state programs similar to benefits under the Food Stamp Act of 1977.

SEC. 5. DERIVATIVE ELIGIBILITY FOR BENEFITS. SEC. 5. DERIVATIVE ELIGIBILITY FOR BENEFITS. Repeals Section 436 of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. The amendment allows Cuban and Haitian entrants to be eligible for benefits under the Food Stamp Act of 1977. The effective date of this Act and its amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996.
